Question
========

It is given that P(A) = 0.4, P(B) = 0.25 and P(A ∩ B) = 0.1. Are the events A and B independent?

Answerlist
----------

* Yes, because P(A) = P(B | A).
* Yes, because P(A) x P(B) = P(A ∩ B).
* No, because P(A) ≠ P(A | B).
* No, because P(A ∩ B) ≤ P(A).

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* Yes, because P(A) = P(B | A)...: Incorrect
* Yes, because P(A) x P(B) = P(A ∩ B)...: Correct
* No, because P(A) ≠ P(A | B)...: Incorrect
* No, because P(A ∩ B) ≤ P(A)...: Incorrect
